title: DNA testing site 23andMe files for bankruptcy protection

title: What makes a rum Jamaican? Question at heart of Caribbean legal dispute

description: Veterinarian professionals are committing suicide at a higher rate than the general population.

title: US to import millions of eggs from Turkey and South Korea to ease prices

description: ‘Can’t Look Away: The Case Against Social Media,’ by directors Matthew O’Neill and Perri Peltz and based on Olivia Carville’s investigative reporting, will premiere April 4 on Jolt.

title: Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco Release New Album ‘I Said I Love You First’
description: To accompany the 15-track album, which is centered around the couple’s relationship, the pair have released a new music video for “Young and Hotter Than Me,” which also has Gomez reflecting on her life of child stardom.

description: The two rappers also released a music video, which features cameos from John Mayer, Matt Damon and Nicholas Braun.

title: Japanese Breakfast Release New Album ‘For Melancholy Brunettes (& Sad Women)’
description: The album comes four years after the indie pop group's critically acclaimed 'Jubilee.'

description: The organization If You Heard What I Heard presented a “Night of Resilience” with headliner Matisyahu.

title: A Whitesell Brother’s Ex Is Pitching a TV Show
description: But it's not about the Whitesell Brothers. Instead, Ladan Rafii is taking meetings around town about a series based on her globe-trotting life as a UN officer.

title: How The Creative Coalition Will Converge on Capitol Hill
description: On April 25, TCC president Tim Daly and a horde of celebrity delegates will make their case to the White House and Congress for continued federal funding of the arts: "Supporting the arts isn’t charity — it’s sound economic policy."

title: Primary Wave Finalizes Deal For Biggie Smalls Catalog
description: Sources previously told The Hollywood Reporter the rapper’s estate was seeking at least $100 million in the deal.

title: Courtney Love is Making Her U.K. Move Permanent, Calls Trump 2.0 “Emperor-core”
description: "Can’t get rid of me!" the undisputed queen of grunge rock told the London crowd then slammed the Trump administration at a Royal Geographical Society event.
